What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.

Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I greatly improved in my ability to listen and understand Italian. My grammar also improved. I also learned about the morphology and etymology of words.
language acquisition
Further study of Italian, focusing on verb tenses/moods (conditional, past/present subjunctive, etc.)
Further development of Italian grammar and speaking
n/a
Italian proficiency
I learned how to synthesize my thoughts in Italian and start to feel comfortable with conversation skills.
I learned the basic skills that are required for success in the Italian language.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: This course was very reasonable in workload and exams. It could be improved by having some kind of study guide for the in class exams.
it was interesting
Wenbin gao is THE MAN
n/a
He was a fantastic teacher who made me very engaged in the course work

The strengths of this course is that the Italian departments if far less intense than other languages like French or Spanish. But like with other courses, your success is based on your effort of engagement in the course.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: I would recommend this class. I have enjoyed learning Italian and feel like the department is very reasonable and understanding.
Yes I would recommend
Yes. The Italian department is awesome, and you learn a lot very quickly
Yes, the teacher was great
I would definitely recommend this course to others. Wenbin Gao is an amazing teacher who really care3s for his students. He prioritizes their learning over everything.
I would.
